org.xchain.framework.hibernate

Class RebindingDataSourceConnectionProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.framework.hibernate.RebindingDataSourceConnectionProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.hibernate.connection.ConnectionProvider

    public class RebindingDataSourceConnectionProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.hibernate.connection.ConnectionProvider
    A data source connection provider that will rebind the data source if it fails to create a connection. When using the 'hibernate.connection.datasource' property, XChains will use this connection provider, unless the property 'hibernate.connection.provider_class' has been specified in the configuration.
    Author:
    Christian Trimble, Josh Kennedy

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(java.util.Properties properties)
               throws org.hibernate.HibernateException
        Configures this connection provider with the specified properties. This method will only fail with a hibernate exception if the 'hibernate.connection.datasource' property is not specified, or if the JNDI initial context cannot be created. Otherwise, this method will log any problems with the configuration, or looking up the data source and return normally.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface org.hibernate.connection.ConnectionProvider
        Throws:
        org.hibernate.HibernateException - if the property 'hibernate.connection.datasource' property is not specified, or if the JNDI initial context cannot be created.

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets a connection from the datasource bound to jndi. If getting the connection fails, this method will attempt to rebind the datasource once, then fail if rebinding fails or the newly bound DataSource fails. This method is synchronized, so that not more than one thread attempts to rebind the datasource at a time. This should not cause a major performance hit, since the datasource pool will most likely be synchronized as well.
        Specified by:
        getConnection in interface org.hibernate.connection.ConnectionProvider
        Returns:
        a connection to the data source, creating a new data source if required.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a fresh copy of the datasource from JNDI caused an exception to be thrown.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection(java.sql.Connection connection)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Closes the specified connection.
        Specified by:
        closeConnection in interface org.hibernate.connection.ConnectionProvider
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to close.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an exception is thrown while closing the connection.
